summary: Successfully resolved the critical JavaScript parsing errors in ProFireManager Settings module. The modify buttons for guard types are now fully functional, including modal opening, form editing, and save operations with backend integration.

minor_issues.impact: Minor HTTP status code inconsistency - does not affect functionality

passed_tests: JavaScript parsing errors completely resolved - frontend compiles without errors
Settings module loads correctly with 3 guard type cards displayed
All modify buttons (✏️ Modifier) are clickable and functional
Edit modals open successfully with proper form fields (nom, heure_debut, heure_fin, personnel_requis, couleur, officier_obligatoire)
Form fields are fully interactive and accept user input
Save functionality works correctly - changes are persisted to backend
UI updates immediately after save - modified names visible in guard type cards
Modal closes automatically after successful save operation
Backend API PUT /api/types-garde/{id} working correctly with proper validation
Multiple modify buttons tested - all working consistently
Backend API integration fully functional for guard type modifications
Authentication and authorization working correctly for admin users
Settings page navigation working from sidebar
ProFireManager branding and red fire department theme intact

success_percentage.backend: 98% (34/35 tests passed - only minor HTTP status code issues)
success_percentage.overall: 99% - Settings module modify functionality fully resolved

action_item_for_E1: ISSUE COMPLETELY RESOLVED! The Settings module modify buttons are now fully functional. The JavaScript parsing errors have been fixed by removing orphaned code fragments and creating a clean Parametres component. All functionality is working: modify buttons open modals, form fields are editable, and save operations successfully update the backend and UI.
should_call_test_agent_after_fix: false - All critical functionality is working correctly. The Settings module modify buttons issue has been completely resolved with full backend integration.
